main event: A civilian observer reported seeing a single round, silver object that looked like a star or balloon over Brooklyn, New York on September 24, 1952.
interesting points: The object was observed at a 45-degree angle from west to east, moving in a straight line with no maneuvers.
The observation lasted for about half an hour.
Two observers were watching pigeons when they noticed the object.
Weather conditions were clear with unlimited visibility.
The air police officer who interviewed the observers concluded the object could have been any type of high-altitude airborne object.
witnesses: two civilian observers, a 15-year-old student and a 45-year-old New York police officer
photographs: no, there are no photographs included in the report
